@@ @@

[[=]]
+ Chapter 5: Fabrications
[[/=]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]

||~ CAMERA FOOTAGE TRANSCRIPTION||

**Date:** July 29th, 2017
**Location:** [CENSORED]

[[div style="border-bottom:2px solid #777; margin-bottom:1px;"]]
[[/div]]
[[div style="border-bottom:1px solid #777;"]]
[[/div]]

**Mr. Stewart (MC&D):** So what’s the catch?

**D.C. al Fine:** There is none. This is simply part of our Transparency Act.

**O5-4 (SCPF):** A little late for that.

**D.C. al Fine:** Better late than never.

**Lasky Neumann (MCF):** To be perfectly honest with you, madame, how are you expecting us to trust you now? You wouldn’t be happy either to find our people spying on yours.

**D.C. al Fine:** And what of you?

**Lasky Neumann (MCF):** We are a humanitarian organization. There’s no point in dealing with espionage.

**D.C. al Fine:** I never said you were.

//O5-4 clears his throat.//

**O5-4 (SCPF):** Manna’s Mission Board is concerned, and rightfully so. I agree with him. Two-hundred and fifty-eight agents were found within my organization, gathering information that you had no right to know about. I have no doubt other members of this room found similar numbers. The cat’s out of the cage, al Fine. We know you’ve been watching us closely. Too closely.

//Al Fine sighs.//

**D.C. al Fine:** I won’t change how your organizations will approach mine. That’s beyond my jurisdiction. I am simply acting within the constraints of my position.

**Cobalt (CI):** Hah! Constraints. That’s a good one.

//Al Fine glares at Cobalt.//

**D.C. al Fine:** We’re all the same in this room. Whether it’s watching another or stealing words on paper, we’re all hypocrites because we condemn the very things we do. Of course, we have an image to keep, so we tidy our blood money underneath a rug. We lie, deceive, and pretend. But if there is one fact that is irrefutable from this conversation, it is that Acheron will find out who killed my people, whether they’re within the Coalition...

//Al Fine glances at one of the delegates.//

**D.C. al Fine:** Or out. 

[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="blockquote"]]

||~ CAMERA FOOTAGE TRANSCRIPTION||

**Date:** April 18th, 2019
**Location:** Acheron, Helipad

[[div style="border-bottom:2px solid #777; margin-bottom:1px;"]]
[[/div]]
[[div style="border-bottom:1px solid #777;"]]
[[/div]]

//Azrael Silver exits the helicopter, its spinning rotors tossing clouds of dust into the air. Exiting the aircraft, he looks around, his head on a constant swivel as he hastens for the temple entrance//

//Buttoning his coat, Azrael watches his back every other second, his head kept down and low.//

**Charon:** Greetings—

//Azrael flinches, nearly falling back. He reaches for an object on his belt.//

**Charon:** Is there a problem, Found One?

//Shaking out of his daze, Azrael bows his head.//

**Azrael:** Sorry. Just a bit on edge today.

**Charon:** Again?

[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="blockquote"]]

||~ CAMERA FOOTAGE TRANSCRIPTION||

**Date:** April 18th, 2019
**Location:** Acheron, Hart Lake Ports

[[div style="border-bottom:2px solid #777; margin-bottom:1px;"]]
[[/div]]
[[div style="border-bottom:1px solid #777;"]]
[[/div]]

//Azrael watches the Waterise from a wooden port, hands in his pockets and occasionally looking around. The candlelit lanterns cast a long shadow over the Hart Lake waters, its waves falling then rising.//

//The port creaks. Azrael swings around, finding nothing behind him.//

**Nize:** Sharp.

//Azrael turns to his left, a silhouette standing from the adjacent port.//

**Azrael:** You called me?

//Nize walks off the port and onto the harbor, moving toward Azrael.//

**Nize:** At least you knew something was amiss.

//Azrael sighed.//

**Azrael:** I told you I’m not interested.

**Nize:** I’m not here to recruit.

**Azrael:** Then what’s happening?

//Nize stands inland before the port Azrael stands on.//

**Nize:** You seem paranoid.

**Azrael:** Answer the goddamn question.

//Nize holds up a small earpiece device.//

**Azrael:** What’s that?

//Nize throws it underhand to Azrael, who fumbles but catches it eventually. Nize pulls out another identical device and places it in his ear.//

**Nize:** Discretion.

[[/div]]

@@ @@

@@ @@

@@ @@

@@ @@

@@ @@

@@ @@

@@ @@

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
God, this is making me nauseous.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
You’ll get used to it. It reads your consciousness, so don’t think about anything embarrassing unless you’re willing to share.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
Yeah, I know. It’s been used to study Type Greens. Why are we using this?
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
Don’t kid with me.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
What?
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
I’ve been watching you look around constantly, watching your back, striding everywhere you walk—you look like you’re uncomfortable in your skin. 
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
And you just explained why I’m like that.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
And you just answered your own question.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

Azrael sighs shallowly, pinching the bridge of his nose. He turned his back on Azrael, watching the water ripple toward the Waterise and retreat from the shore. Nize rubs his temple with his thumb.

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
This isn’t just discretion. This is the plain truth. You know you can’t lie with these things on. Only a deluded person can.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

Azrael faces Nize again.

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
Making sure I can’t lie? You’d make a good Soothsayer.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

Nize walks to and past Azrael to the end of the port, hands in his pants pockets. He twirls one of his ankles using the tip of his shoe.

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
There is no security breach or data leak. PNEUMA isn’t on crutches. It’s functioning just fine. 
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
What?
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
I exposed hundreds of my own covert agents to rival groups. I intentionally led my operatives into traps. I’ve ceded victories we easily could’ve taken for ourselves.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

Nize turns his head to Azrael.

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
I was the one who spread the rumors about Acheron. I fed lies to everyone in and outside of this Coalition, villainizing Acheron as a torture chamber. Santo Domingo, three Foundies missing, traces of thaumaturgy and necromancy, all linked to involvements with the Lapse and vanished into Acheron. That was me.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
Foundies? What the hell are you doing to the Foundation?
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
TACNEC. The reanimation of corpses. I framed your research to make it seem like an unsanctioned project studying the maximal amount of torment one may induce on a—
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
Are you fucking crazy?
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
I’ve been lying to a lot of people. Not just to people outside but also to people who have been with me. You included.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

Nize points to the device in his ear.

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
This ends that.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

Azrael scoffs, speechless, his mouth agape. He shrugs, raising his arms and shaking his head.

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
Ends what? Do you know what you’ve done? Everywhere I go, people are watching me. At some point, I don’t even know if it’s your guys or someone else’s. I don’t know when it’s going to be my last walk before a glint from the distance shoots a bullet into my head. They’re //everywhere.// And you’re telling me this //now?//
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
It’s part of the plan.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
What fucking plan? To get people killed? Because you’re going swimmingly on that front. You think this stick in my ear solves anything? You want my forgiveness, don’t you?
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
Azrael, there are things in motion that are beyond a five-minute conversation. I’m here to offer you the truth in its entirety. You want to know who was responsible for this. Everybody does. And I am close to rectifying what was done.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
And what? Will throwing more bodies into that pit stop it? I find that highly ironic for a guy with pretty bloody hands. You defame my name, you defame this city, you defame //Alice// and everything she stood for.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
I know it’s frustrating.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
Do you?
[[/div]]

@@ @@

Nize steps toward Azrael.

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
I do.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

Nize mouths the words.

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
I’m also tired of hiding. I’m exhausted from chasing the truth for so long. This temptation to expose... it has brewed an impulsive desire within me: to burn this entire world. You know that feeling too. I know you want to find out who did this. And that’s //exactly// what I’m doing.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

Nize trembles, his fists clenched tightly. He steps back, his sight unbreaking from Azrael’s.

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
You offer them a neatly wrapped gift, and they’ll forget about the gun in your coat. They’re so preoccupied with the sweetness of winning that they forget all about the game. I let them chase sounds surrounding them, and they’ll miss where I really stand.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

Nize gestures to the port they stand on. His hooded eyes pierce through Azrael, who pursed his lips. A light fog screen hangs low above Hart Lake, swirling around the legs of the port.

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
Torture. Really? 
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
You watch them react. You scatter it. You throw whispers, voices, and rumors, and they’ll think we have no control. You plant damning evidence that confirms their suspicions, and they won’t think twice. They forget to look down, and before they realize it, they’ll already be falling. And Acheron blinds them from that truth. Once you show a single slit present through their veil of security, something they can’t explain because they //can’t//, you’ll have their attention all the way. That’s what Acheron is—a breach, a threat, some weapon capable of cleaning their dirty lies. Something they cannot control.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
You’re using Acheron to draw attention.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
Their full attention. I sacrificed my people to make them think we’re done for. I’ve sent people into their traps to find where they truly lie, all the more convincing them that we know no better. I’ve spotlighted Acheron to grab their attention so they’ll forget the knife raised behind them. They think we have //nothing.// They think we’re so desperate that we’ve abandoned our doctrines, relying on inhumanity. And to some extent, they’re right, but that’s just mixing a little truth into a lie. //They think we’re weak.// But when they turn around, the knife will have already been plunged into their backs.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

Nize takes another step closer to Azrael.

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
Azrael, I need your help. When one of mine dies, I need to know what they know.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
Jesus Christ.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
And your Zeds, they’re a gateway to avoid death. And as you said, they’re already dead. I don’t want to send any more of our own out there. Not now.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
Avoid death? You’re kidding. You say that //now?//
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
I’m just accepting that we’re already dead.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

Azrael stares blankly at Nize.

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
We’re all tools, Azrael. I know this isn’t something you’re used to, but this is what the truth costs.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
And you think the Foundation is behind this?
[[/div]]

@@ @@

Nize chuckles, smiling with crazed eyes.

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
They have never been more vindictive against us than now. 
[[/div]]

@@ @@

Azrael shakes his head. Nize sighs.

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
Putting Acheron into the public stirred them like a dog chasing a bone. Of course, anyone would be concerned with what Acheron can do. But expensive overreactions like theirs come from people wanting to keep something hidden. They lead the ethical charges against Acheron, stronger than anyone in the Council. ETHCOM has formed countless committees to discuss the permissibility of necromancy alone. //You// know all about it. The people who watch you are //them.// Every day, more and more evidence is mounted against us—piles of evidence they don’t realize are all fabricated.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
You’re delusional.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

Nize reaches into his coat pocket, pulling out a tablet. He offers it to Azrael.

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
You need to trust me.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

Azrael scoffs and chuckles, shaking his head again.

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
Really? You?
[[/div]]

@@ @@

Nize raises his hands.

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
I told you, I can only speak the truth now. This is as vulnerable as I can be.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
Unless you’re delusional. And right now, I’m convinced you are. You spread lies to the point where I have eyes watching me everywhere I go, both here and out there. You’ve killed people. 
[[/div]]

@@ @@

Nize takes another step toward Azrael from the end of the port. The candlelit lanterns flicker.

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
We will never prevail if we don’t make sacrifices.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

He takes another step forward.

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
I know how you felt in St. Atropos. The trollies rolling down the halls, the constant crackles of fire—
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
Don’t.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
The cries that wouldn’t stop and the syringes rolled into the waiting rooms. You couldn’t save any of them. There was not enough to go around. You all had no choice. I know about the bodies that piled outside. The //stench.// Losing everyone.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
SHUT UP!
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
And losing the only person you care about.
[[/div]]

Azrael sprints at Nize, shoving him off the port. The water splashes inversely, preemptively greeting Nize before throwing itself atop him as he sinks. Azrael tries to breathe but forgets he can’t, choking on himself and dry heaving. After gathering himself, he looks around and finds numerous armed operatives inland with their weapons trained at him.

@@ @@

@@ @@

@@ @@

@@ @@

@@ @@

@@ @@

@@ @@

@@ @@

[[div class="blockquote"]]

||~ CAMERA FOOTAGE TRANSCRIPTION||

**Date:** April 18th, 2019
**Location:** Acheron, Hart Lake Ports

[[div style="border-bottom:2px solid #777; margin-bottom:1px;"]]
[[/div]]
[[div style="border-bottom:1px solid #777;"]]
[[/div]]

//Nize emerges, the water slipping off and back into the lake, drying him instantaneously. He ruffles and slicks his hair back, adjusting as he walks back ashore. He looks off to the side, waving someone away. Azrael sits on a bench underneath a candlelit lamp, his foot drawing lines on the loose path made of lead. Nize stands before him for a moment before finally joining him.//

**Nize:** I’m sorry.

//Nize rubs the corner of his mouth, staring at the fogged ground.//

**Nize:** We all lost someone at some point. But that’s why I’m here.

//Nize grabs Azrael’s shoulder, who looks back.//

**Nize:** I want to give their deaths the meaning they deserve as much as you do. It won't be an easy path. It’s going to be messy.

//Nize faces Azrael.//

**Nize:** But I cannot accept a place that quietly accepts the silencing of a thousand voices. So, are you with me?

//Azrael shrugs Nize’s hand off his shoulder, staring at the Riverise.//

**Azrael:** That wasn’t another big lie?

//Nize pulls out the same tablet from before, offering it to Azrael. Azrael sighs shallowly, letting his head hang back over the bench’s backrest. He closes his eyes. Finally, he sits up and takes the tablet, scrolling through its contents.//

[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="blockquote"]]

||~ CAMERA FOOTAGE TRANSCRIPTION||

**Date:** April 19th, 2019
**Location:** Acheron, Hart Lake Ports

[[div style="border-bottom:2px solid #777; margin-bottom:1px;"]]
[[/div]]
[[div style="border-bottom:1px solid #777;"]]
[[/div]]

//Azrael places the tablet on the bench between him and Nize, who opens his eyes and then stretches. He looks at the tablet and then at Azrael.//

**Nize:** Done reading?

**Azrael:** I’m still not sure if I’m convinced.

//Nize scoffs.//

**Nize:** In my opinion, I don’t believe it’s a matter of validity. It’s a matter of acceptance.

**Azrael:** It just feels surreal. I’ve been hoping Acheron could reveal the truth, but when I realized it too suffered death’s laws—its inevitability, I was so disappointed. 

//Azrael covers his face with his hands.//

**Azrael:** I wanted to break through Acheron’s limitations. All I found was TACNEC; an army reliant on corpses.

//Azrael leans his forearms against his knees.//

**Azrael:** I had a dream. I was looking through this mirror, but instead of my reflection, I saw Alice. In my hand, I held the same quillon dagger. She wore this frown—one that seemed uncanny. Unhuman. And the next thing I knew, I threw the dagger at the mirror.

//Azrael looks at Nize.//

**Azrael:** And through the falling glass shards, I could still see her. But between the gaps, where I could see the other side without the glass, a Zed stood there. Its hollow eyes pierced me, a rifle at hand. God, I tried to bring them back, but only their corpses answered. It’s that moment I realized that I was still not moving on.

//Nize nods, his leg fidgeting.//

**Nize:** You’ve bent the rules before.

**Azrael:** That doesn’t make it okay.

**Nize:** Maybe. But if you could try it all again, I know you would. Even if there was a sliver of a chance.

//Azrael shakes his head.//

**Azrael:** I’d be too caught up denying fate rather than spending my final minutes with her.

**Nize:** I don’t see it that way. In my opinion, you didn’t give up on her. And I’m not about to give up on this.

//Azrael watches as Nize stands up, twisting and stretching his body.//

**Nize:** This is different. Injustice plagues everyone and everything. Not just one person or yourself. //Everyone.// I know you, Azrael. You’re not the type to give up, and certainly not on everyone now. And you’re not afraid to sacrifice your image and be misunderstood.

//Nize turns to Azrael.//

**Nize:** You’ve seen the lives affected—countless broken like yours. You’ve bandaged many of those wounds. Now we need to suture it close.

//Azrael scoffs.//

**Azrael:** I think you’re overestimating me.

//Azrael watches the warm yellow lights illuminate a dark city district from afar. Oracles and humans walking the streets cast fleeting shadows against steel columns and arches. Aside from occasional chatter reverberating across the cavern from afar, it was quiet. Serene. Azrael stands up and extends his hand.//

**Azrael:** But I’m tired of sitting around.

//Nize nods, taking Azrael’s hand and shaking it.//

[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div style="border-bottom:2px solid #777; margin-bottom:1px;"]]
[[/div]]
[[div style="border-bottom:1px solid #777;"]]
[[/div]]

[[=]]
+ Chapter 6: Forefront
[[/=]]

@@ @@

@@ @@

@@ @@

@@ @@

@@ @@

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
And I just read off this paper?
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
Correct.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
Will this really work?
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
It’ll make things worse, but I assure you, when we release all of the recordings I’ve collected, your name will be cleared.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

Azrael sighs.

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
So your name is...
[[/div]]

@@ @@

Azrael squints at the sheet of paper he’s holding.

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
Leon Periklis?
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
A PHYSICS Assessment Team member. I report a Foundation convoy transporting weapons. We found this convoy from a Captain we’re holding hostage here after torturing him using Astral Projection and his family as hostages. You give me the order to attack the convoy. The rest will be handled by myself.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

//Azrael looks at Nize.//

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
What //really// is this?
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
NIZE
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
VOIDSEEKER. They’re transporting supplies for it.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
You’re not going to kill them, right?
[[/div]]

@@ @@

Nize shakes his head.

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
And you’re sure they’re listening?
[[/div]]

@@ @@

Nize nods.

@@ @@

[[=]]
AZRAEL
[[/=]]
[[div class="indent"]] 
Alright, let’s get this over with.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

@@ @@

@@ @@

@@ @@

@@ @@

@@ @@

[[div class="blockquote"]]

||~ CAMERA FOOTAGE TRANSCRIPTION||

**Date:** April 27th, 2019
**Location:** Acheron, Hart Lake Ports

[[div style="border-bottom:2px solid #777; margin-bottom:1px;"]]
[[/div]]
[[div style="border-bottom:1px solid #777;"]]
[[/div]]

**Azrael:** What's the spiel?

**Nize:** Weapons transfer. Twelve men, two cars, six each, one with the payload. Tomorrow, Montana, 0500 local time. I have a Strike Team on-site right now.

//Jack Welsh swings open the closet door. Supervisor Kinsey Aishatu flinches, gripping her holster.//

**Kinsey:** Holy shit.

**Jack:** Sorry, sorry.

//Jack closes the door behind him, entering the cramped 2x2 meter room, nearly tripping over a janitorial bucket. Kinsey sighs, shaking her head//

**Jack:** I got one.

//Kinsey perks up.//

**Kinsey:** Really?

//Jack puts his laptop on a plastic container, pivoting the screen to Kinsey, who leans in.//

**Jack:** Nine transmissions from the STARSEEKER platform. They used the SCiPnet to move data.

**Kinsey:** What? They’re crazy. Anyone here can see that.

**Jack:** Yet they did it. All nine of those transmissions relate to EVENTIDE.

**Kinsey:** The Lapse.

**Jack:** Exactly. All of the data were transmitted to Acheron, as you predicted.

//Jack turns to Kinsey.//

**Jack:** That’s our FOREFRONT.

**Kinsey:** Do you have security footage?

**Jack:** No. They’re not //that// idiotic.

**Kinsey:** But idiotic enough. They’ve been careful so far, but now they’re starting to slip. If we were still cracking down on them full-time, we would’ve found them right now. 

//Kinsey looks at Jack.//

**Kinsey:** Surely they know this isn’t enough. We have data traps, AIC surveillance, etc. Our firewall and security are too unique for them. How are they still treading on such thin ice? And why now? Making a mistake now would be fatal.

**Jack:** I don’t think the GOC has //any// experienced agents left. Most of them defected, and the rest were snuffed out. Acheron is practically their last-standing intelligence facility, and they no longer have the eyes to keep up at our pace anymore. 

**Kinsey:** None of that was truly confirmed. For all I know, they might be doing this intentionally.

//Jack sighs.//

**Jack:** They’ll have to run before they can sprint again.

**Kinsey:** I’m not buying that.

//Kinsey stands up, and Jack steps aside, his back against the shelves of cleaning supplies.//

**Kinsey:** But this is as direct as it can be where evidence is concerned. Missing logs of EVENTIDE, papers from Site-58, the whole nine yards. You mailed the details to me?

**Jack:** Way ahead of you.

//Kinsey nods and opens the door.//

**Kinsey:** Keep searching the servers; maybe we can pick up a scent from there. You have my clearance if you need anything else.

**Jack:** Should we tell the director this?

//Kinsey sighs.//

**Kinsey:** I can try, but he won’t listen. He’s more obsessed with the fucking Assimilation Program and Acheron. We’re on our own for this one.

**Jack:** Alright. Take care of yourself, Kinsey.

//Kinsey shuts the door behind her. Jack sits back down, slouching.//

> Almost immediately after the initiation of the Lapse, Acting Assistant Director Nize for PNEUMA EXSEC was notified of a Foundation defector, codenamed FOREFRONT, who claimed to be at RAISA’s legitimate headquarters: [[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/secure-facility-dossier-site-7#|Site-7 at Norton Sound, located 81 km northeast of Alaska’s coast.]]]

>> I was originally from Special Assets in PANGAEA.

>> I got the call from the scary lady herself to take the helm.
>>

> FOREFRONT alleged that the Foundation was responsible for the Lapse and that the majority of its personnel (exempting administrative departments) were unaware of the Foundation’s misdeeds. FOREFRONT was also responsible for revealing the locations of forged RAISA outposts filled with counterintelligence assets meant to conceal the true location of their headquarters.
> 
> After extensive background screening and creating contingent blackmails, FOREFRONT was inducted into EXSEC’s Defection Initiative, working as a Coalition double agent. FOREFRONT was promised asylum and an optional identity reassignment operation should he fulfill his objectives.

> * The exposure of these fake facilities enabled Coalition aetheric cartographers to narrow down the suspected location of RAISA’s headquarters, tracing back to Site-7 after referring to past intelligence reports and tracking quantum linkages.
> * These results confirm the legitimacy of FOREFRONT’s intelligence.
> 
> The revealing of these sleeper agents convinced the Foundation that the Coalition was now incapable of mounting an intelligence attack. However, unbeknownst to the Foundation, several experiential GOC sleeper agents were spared, with only one being sent to Site-7 to minimize suspicions while riding the frenzy of exposures.
> 
> Several other misleading clues were left behind in other Foundation facilities to divert attention away from Site-7.

>> 
>> It was at that point when I really accepted the fact that I was dead.

It’s because of them we found Site-7 and confirmed FOREFRONT’s validity. There were only so many traps you could set before a rat would eventually find your room.
>> 
>> I wish the Soothsayers and Pilgrims could do everything for us. I really wish I didn’t have to do that. But even the stricken constraints of death compel them, as you’ve said. 
>> 
>> It’s funny. Even in a world where the laws of death could be bent, it still can’t escape its terminality. I don’t think anything is forever.
>> 
>> What I know is that when this washes over, not even heaven will forgive me.

> __Operation Tunnel Vision Phase I:__ To further confirm the Foundation’s involvement, EXSEC shifted its disinformation campaign to focus public attention on Acheron using the __Transparency Act__—a legislative motion meant to repair diplomatic distrust caused by the revealing of PNEUMA’s espionage operations. 
> 
> It was explicitly stated to foreign delegates that the GOC would use Acheron to reveal the party responsible for the Lapse. EXSEC agents would await suspicious movements following that release.

>> Dr. Cirilo knew a lot, but not enough, and Officer Thea exhibited immense guilt. Although we have witnesses and testimonies now, that is unfortunately the weakest form of evidence.

>> As of now, any open spaces within the necropolis are easy picks for the Foundation. It’s a level of eavesdropping that defies distance.

>> And I’ve made sure of that.

> FOREFRONT has amassed direct evidence of the Foundation’s involvement with the Lapse. However, due to the files’ encrypted nature, they must be physically relocated. Possible backdoors and methods to digitally transmit the data, including the use of Earwig bugs, have been unsuccessful. As a result, the data has been stored in a physical, specialized HDD (hard disk drive) and will be offloaded to a secure Coalition facility.

>> Remember my comments about how we only have found circumstantial evidence? That is intentional.
>> 
>> These are things called __Soft Evidence.__ It could stir a scandal, sure, but it won’t prove anything substantial.

>> It’s both resource-friendly and deceptive. Sink-and-hook line.

>>

**Miller:** HOW MANY FUCKING MISSILES DOES THAT THING HAVE!?

//Miller ducks into the downed, blazing helicopter, clutching onto the charcoaled case holding the HDD with his body as three more missiles strike two meters off.//

**Fox:** He's going to run out! Get ready for him to switch to guns.

//Fox watches as the F-15E fighter turns sharply, charging straight at one of her operatives. She tackles them, lunging them away from the gun strafe.//

**Fox:** Fucking CHRIST! USE YOUR PROPULSIONS!

//Nize leapfrogs, each jump throwing him 30 meters away. He stops, watching the sky as the Foundation jet performs an Immelmann, inverting itself and rolling its belly back down, its nose now toward Nize. He waits, watching it. A flash emits, and immediately, he leaps aside, a row of snow soaring into the air, screening the area where Nize once stood with tracers bouncing off the surface. The audio feed normalized the incoming sounds of impact that would’ve otherwise been deafening. A latent roar emits from the jet as it whizzes by.//

//A missile heads toward Nize, launched from underneath the jet’s wings. He waits, watching it as its size grows exponentially. Before the last possible moment, he leaps again, crashing onto the ground with his hands on his head, shrapnel flying from behind. As he pushes himself back up onto his feet, he looks at his right forearm, a large metal sheet stuck onto it. Blood seeps through the crack.//

**Azrael:** Zeds in position.

**Fox:** Engage!

//A trail of smoke shoots out of the forest, homing onto the jet. Immediately, it banked up, shooting out flares and turning. One of the flares exploded into a brilliant fireball.//

**Fox:** Miss! Send another one! Keep him occupied!

//Another trail launches from the forest. But then, Fox perks up and turns around. Using her HUD’s system, her camera zooms into an incoming helicopter.//

**Fox:** Is that ours?

**Avid:** Negative. I’m trying to get PALISADE to ID it.

**Fox:** If it’s mundane, we’re going to have a field day where Second Mission priorities are concerned.

**Nize:** No. Tell me what kind of heli it is.

//The Foundation jet zips by Fox’s view, twisting in an aileron roll as it deploys another set of flares. The SAM missile fails to hit the jet, exploding again at its flares and blocking Fox’s view.//

**Fox:** Shit!

**Avid:** Stand by. Let me take a peek.

**Fox:** How many more you got, Azrael?

**Azrael:** Three!

**Fox:** Make ‘em count.

//Another missile shoots out from the forest. Instead of evading it immediately, the jet raises its nose, climbing toward the clouds.//

**Fox:** Shit. Shit! AZRAEL BRACE!

//The jet performs a wingover, pivoting itself back toward the Earth. It gradually creates distance between itself and the missile following close behind, shooting a stream of bullets into the forest where the smoke trails originate. It pulls up, white vapor covering the underside of its wings, just grazing the top of the treeline and letting the missile following it slam into the ground. A black cloud shoots up, and fire envelops the surrounding trees.//

**Fox:** Jesus. Azrael, status?

**Azrael:** Stinger’s intact! I lost a bunch, but I’ll get the remnants to retrieve it. 

**Fox:** Get it back up immediately!

**Azrael:** It looks like he doesn’t know where they’re at though! I’m going to reposition them.

**Avid:** Nize, it’s a Bell Textron G2G. It looks commercial.

**Nize:** Is there an emblem on the side of its tail boom?

**Avid:** Uh... yes.

**Nize:** What is it?

**Avid:** Shipping, Containers, and Produ—oh.

**Nize:** Azrael! Change target!

**Azrael:** What?! Are you sure?!

//Another stream of bullets whiplashes the ground next to Nize, slicing a Zed in half while nearly cutting Nize’s head off, the impact sending him flying into the air. He slams on the ground, the shrapnel on his forearm digging deeper upon impact. He winces.//

**Nize:** For FUCK sakes! YES!

**Azrael:** Standby! Almost there!

**Avid:** Shit. I think the chopper knows what’s happening now. It’s turning away!

**Fox:** Fuck it. Azrael, belay Nize’s orders. Keep that jet off me. Everyone else, CLEAR MY AREA!

//The operatives retreat away from Fox, distancing themselves.//

//Fox recalibrates her HUD into a specialized set of targeting arrays. She pulls out the 20 caliber round from her suit's compartment and adjusts her crosshair so it hovers over the helicopter. Various parabolic curves form the perimeter of a red translucent area orbiting the crosshair, acting as a visual reference for the margin of error by accounting for gravity, wind, drag, and other confounding factors.//

//She braces her right leg back, left leg in front. She points at the approximate location of the helicopter with her left hand, raising the bullet up and back with her right. Then, she slightly tilts her upper body up.//

//She brings her left hand to her right, lifts her left knee to her abdomen, twisting her torso to the right, reversing the shock absorbers on her suit’s right arm and redirecting it to the rest. The jet comes into view, pointed straight at Fox in the way of her view.//

**Azrael:** OUT OF THE WAY!

//Another Stinger missile is launched.//

//Fox throws her body down, and her left boot hammers into the ground, sending out a trembling wave underneath as particulates fly into the air. She swings her body, throwing the bullet and letting her momentum and reversed absorbers propel it a hundredfold.//

//The jet lets out a short burst of bullets before turning away, evading the Stinger missile. One of the Zeds fling themselves between Fox and the incoming rounds. The strafe peppers through the Zed and onto Fox’s chest, sending her flying back. Her visual feed cuts out.//

//Nize watches as the 20 caliber round Fox threw blurs past through the air. And then, from afar, a flash of smoke shoots out from the commercial helicopter’s tail. It tilts, trying to stabilize itself, before spiraling down toward the ground.//

**Nize:** Azrael!

**Azrael:** Shit, shit. Is she okay? 

**Nize:** AZRAEL!

**Azrael:** Fuck. On it!

//The helicopter inevitably hits the ground.//

||~ BODYCAM FOOTAGE TRANSCRIPTION||

**Date:** August 13th, 2022
**Location:** Southeast Fairbanks, Alaska

[[div style="border-bottom:2px solid #777; margin-bottom:1px;"]]
[[/div]]
[[div style="border-bottom:1px solid #777;"]]
[[/div]]

//The footage comes back alive. Kinsey coughs, throwing rubble off of her. The helicopter’s right side is dug into the ground, its left pointed at the sky. Another operative coughs. He stands up, letting a cover of black dirt fall off him.//

**Preacher:** Shit.

//Preacher coughs, slinging his rifle back and climbing over the helicopter’s edge. He offers a hand to Kinsey.//

**Preacher:** Over here, ma’am.

//Kinsey groans.//

**Kinsey:** What about the pilots?

**Preacher:** Dead. We need to move quickly.

**Kinsey:** Shit, shit.

//Kinsey gets up slowly, steadying herself with the helicopter’s tilted seats. She grabs Preacher’s hand, pulling herself up and out of the helicopter. She falls to the ground with her legs, coughing as water splashes around her.//

**Preacher:** Come on.

//Preacher falls to the ground, scrambling and pushing Kinsey back up with him, flinging water into the air.//

//There is a snap from the row of trees lining the side of the river. Preacher lets Kinsey go, letting her fall onto the river, and brings his rifle up. He sweeps his barrel across the treeline, erratically turning about.//

//Kinsey laments, sitting upright, the flowing water pushing against her elbows.//

//One by one, humanoids in battered and dirtied armor appear intermittently from the treeline with their weapons pointed at Preacher.//

**Kinsey:** Fuckers.

//Before Kinsey could reach for her holster, the camera shook. It pans to the left, seeing another one of the humanoids rush at Kinsey and Preacher, creating a wake behind them. Preacher swings his rifle at the incoming humanoid and opens fire, his gun set to semi. To no avail, the humanoid digs its boots into the ground, braking and kicking a wave of water at Kinsey and Preacher. The humanoid, right behind the wave, then throws the dismayed Preacher down onto his back and into the water.//

//The humanoid pulls out a handgun and points it at Preacher.//

//One of the other operatives from the treeline moves to Kinsey, their rifle trained at her.//

**Azrael:** Don’t reach.

//Kinsey spits at Azrael.//

**Azrael:** It won’t do you good anyways.

**Kinsey:** The sight before death. Go on, kill me, Gawker.

//Azrael’s grip on his rifle hardens. He raises it closer to his eye, looking down on Kinsey. Eventually, he lowers it, letting it hang on his side.//

**Azrael:** As much as I’d love to, I’d rather listen to your reason than kill it. So that’s exactly what we’ll be doing.
